title: Particle motion with quadratic velocity function

content.question: A particle moves on the x-axis so that its velocity at any time t ≥ 0 is given by v(t) = 12t2 − 36t + 15. At t = 1, the particle is at the origin. (a) Find the position x(t) of the particle at any time t ≥ 0.

frqParts.text: A particle moves on the x-axis so that its velocity at any time t ≥ 0 is given by v(t) = 12t2 − 36t + 15. At t = 1, the particle is at the origin. (a) Find the position x(t) of the particle at any time t ≥ 0.
(b) Find all values of t for which the particle is at rest.
(c) Find the maximum velocity of the particle for 0 ≤ t ≤ 2.
Find the total distance traveled by the particle from t = 0 to t = 2.
